newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE PRICES.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH SHELL RAISES GASOLINE PRICES.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell unit Shell Nederland BV said on Friday it would raise its retail prices for gasoline in the Netherlands by one cent per litre with effect from Monday May 26.
The move reflects changes in international product prices and the value of the dollar against the guilder, the company said.
From Monday the price of premium unleaded gasoline at Shell's self-service stations will go up to 2.11 guilders per litre.
The price of premium with lead substitute rises to 2.18 guilders and Euro regular unleaded to 2.06 guilders.
The recommended price for diesel remains unchanged at 1.458 guilders per litre, Shell said.
